sense.name: ring or echo with sound
sense.commentary: NOTE: Does not imply that sound is bouncing off of a particular surface.
sense.examples: The singing reverberated through the chamber. The hall reverberated with laughter. I came back with a chop so loud that the noise reverberated throughout the building.

sense.name: Have a long or continuing effect.
sense.examples: The case of a single 11-inch smallmouth bass has reverberated far beyond a Maine lake and the fishing lodges of Maine's Grand Lake. The discussions reverberated throughout his adult life. While I had expected a certain level of cheesiness, there were also some underlying themes that reverberated in my life. Effects of the stock fall reverberated throughout the market.

sense.name: Be reflected as heat, light, or shock waves;.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Does not include sound as traditionally conceived, but includes sonar.
sense.examples: Waves reverberated off the shore. Sonar pulses reverberated along the hull.

sense.name: Process, or refine in a reverberating furnace
